Package kaitech.database

Class InventoryTblImpl

  • java.lang.Object
    • kaitech.api.database.AbstractTable
      • kaitech.database.InventoryTblImpl
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    InventoryTable
    public class InventoryTblImpl
extends AbstractTable
implements InventoryTable
    InventoryTblImpl extends AbstractTable, implements the InventoryTable interface, and permits limited access to the data stored in the inventory table.

    • Constructor Detail

      • InventoryTblImpl

        public InventoryTblImpl​(DatabaseHandler dbHandler,
                        IngredientTable ingredientTable)
        Constructor for the InventoryTable. On instantiation, greedy loads the codes of ingredients into cache.
        Parameters:
        dbHandler - The DatabaseHandler to load the inventory from and save to.
        ingredientTable - The IngredientTable for the business, containing information about ingredients.

    • Method Detail

      • getIngredientQuantity

        public java.lang.Integer getIngredientQuantity​(Ingredient ingredient)
        Description copied from interface: InventoryTable
        Retrieves an ingredient's quantity in stock from the cache. If the ingredient does not currently exist in the cache, query the database for the quantity. If the query is successful, add the ingredient and its quantity to the cache and return it.
        Specified by:
        getIngredientQuantity in interface InventoryTable
        Parameters:
        ingredient - The Ingredient to retrieve.
        Returns:
        The integer quantity of the ingredient in stock if it exists, null if it does not or cannot be retrieved.

      • getAllStockCodes

        public java.util.Set<java.lang.String> getAllStockCodes()
        Description copied from interface: InventoryTable
        Get the codes of all ingredients currently in stock.
        Specified by:
        getAllStockCodes in interface InventoryTable
        Returns:
        A set of ingredient codes.

      • putInventory

        public void putInventory​(Ingredient ingredient,
                         int quantity)
                  throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Description copied from interface: InventoryTable
        Saves a given ingredient and its quantity to the database, assuming that the ingredient already exists in the ingredients table.
        Specified by:
        putInventory in interface InventoryTable
        Parameters:
        ingredient - The Ingredient to be saved.
        quantity - The quantity of the ingredient in stock.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      • removeInventory

        public void removeInventory​(Ingredient ingredient)
        Description copied from interface: InventoryTable
        Remove an ingredient and its quantity from the database and cache.
        Specified by:
        removeInventory in interface InventoryTable
        Parameters:
        ingredient - The Ingredient to be removed.

      • resolveInventory

        public java.util.Map<Ingredient,​java.lang.Integer> resolveInventory()
        Description copied from interface: InventoryTable
        Gets all ingredients and their quantities from the database, given the ingredients table. Warning: this can be a costly operation when everything isn't already cached, please use with care.
        Specified by:
        resolveInventory in interface InventoryTable
        Returns:
        A map from Ingredient to integer quantity.

      • setQuantity

        public void setQuantity​(Ingredient ingredient,
                        int newAmt)
                 throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Description copied from interface: InventoryTable
        Directly set the quantity of the ingredient in the inventory table. Throws IllegalArgumentException if the amount is negative.
        Specified by:
        setQuantity in interface InventoryTable
        Parameters:
        ingredient - The Ingredient to set the quantity of.
        newAmt - The new amount for the Ingredient.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      • updateQuantity

        public void updateQuantity​(Ingredient ingredient,
                           int change)
                    throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Description copied from interface: InventoryTable
        Updates the given ingredient's quantity by the amount specified, which may be positive or negative. Throws IllegalArgumentException if the amount is negative and would result in the ingredient having a negative quantity.
        Specified by:
        updateQuantity in interface InventoryTable
        Parameters:
        ingredient - The Ingredient to update the quantity of.
        change - The signed integer amount to update the ingredient's quantity by.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      • updateQuantities

        public void updateQuantities​(java.util.Map<MenuItem,​java.lang.Integer> itemsOrdered)
        Description copied from interface: InventoryTable
        Updates the inventory to remove the items used in the recipes of menu items from sales.
        Specified by:
        updateQuantities in interface InventoryTable
        Parameters:
        itemsOrdered - A map of MenuItem to Integer, where the integer is the number of MenuItems sold. The ingredients required for each MenuItem will have their inventory quantity decreased by the appropriate amount.
